Shoppers were evacuated and Westfield Valley Fair closed for the rest of the evening as officers investigated. The shooting appeared to be isolated and did not involve an active shooter. A suspect has yet to be identified, according to Police Chief Paul Joseph.A preliminary investigation revealed that the male suspect pulled out a firearm from his waistband and fired multiple rounds at a man following a verbal altercation. An adult woman and a 16-year-old female, who are not believed to have been involved in the dispute, were struck by stray bullets, according to the department. All victims were taken to hospitals with non-life-threatening injuries.It is possible that the shooting was gang-related, however the circumstances are still under investigation, police said. ç¾å›½åˆ›ä¸šè€…çš„å¾®åšè§†é¢‘
